document.docAuthor: Silva, Jaqueline Santana Tavares Ferreira Da, Grazia, Jocelia & Barão, Kim Ribeiro
document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of Steleocoris Mayr, 1864 and Theloris Thunberg, 1783 (Hemiptera Pentatomidae), two poorly known African stink bugs

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of Steleocoris Mayr, 1864 and Theloris Thunberg, 1783 (Hemiptera Pentatomidae), two poorly known African stink bugs

mods:name.mods:namePart: Silva, Jaqueline Santana Tavares Ferreira Da

Unidade Educacional Penedo, Campus Arapiraca, Universidade Federal de Alagoas, Penedo, AL, Brazil. kim. barao @ penedo. ufal. br; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0003 - 1432 - 1756

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cimex comma Thunberg, 1783: 41–42
, fig. 56; 1822: 6; Gmelin, 1790: 2146;
Turton, 1802: 629
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Yellow longitudinal stripe dorsally, basally on pronotum and medially along entire scutellum. Head longer than wide, mandibular plates longer than clypeus. Antenniferous tubercles with lateral and ventral tubercles. Antennomere II longer than the remaining antennomeres taken together. Genital cup of pygophore striate. Paramere crown falcate, with microtrichia laterally. Segment X up to two times longer than wide. Gonocoxites VIII as long as wide, swollen, facing posteriorly; posterior and mesial margins setose.

Redescription. Coloration. Dark green, with a median yellow stripe anteriorly on pronotum and along scutellum; corium of each hemelytron yellow with several dark green punctations; membrane of each hemelytron hyaline with dark, irregularly shaped markings ( Figs 1-2 , 9 ). Ventrally, body and legs greenish-yellow, with dark green punctations; yellow median stripe from sternites IV to VII ( Fig. 10 ). Antennae brownish, labium dark brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8. Photographs of live specimens of Stelecoris
comma (Thunberg)
( 1–2 ) and
Theloris costata (Thunberg)
( 3–8 ). Photographs of
Stelocoris comma
by Vynbos (2014) and van Berkel (2015) , respectively; and of
Theloris costata
, by Riegel (2020) ( 3–4 ), van Berkel (2018) ( 5–7 ), and Adam (2015) ( 8 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen. Connexivum exposed. Abdominal spiracles concolorous to abdominal sternites ( Fig. 10 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9–20.
Steleocoris comma (Thunberg)
. 9 , dorsal habitus. 10 , ventral habitus. 11 , detail of antenna, showing antennomeres III-V. 12 , head in ventral view. 13 , meso- and metapleuron; 14–16 , pygophore in dorsal ( 14 ), posterior ( 15 ), and ventral ( 16 ) views. 17 , left paramere. 18–20 , phallus in dorsal ( 18 ), ventral ( 19 ), and lateral ( 20 ) views. Scale bars: 1, 1, 0.5, 1, 1, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25 mm. Abbreviations: cj, conjunctiva; dr, dorsal rim; dsd, ductus seminis distalis; p, paramere; ph,phalloteca; sr, superior ridge; v, vesica; vr, ventral rim.

FIGURES 21–23.
Steleocoris comma (Thunberg)
. 21–22 , female genital plates. 23 , female genital plates and ectodermal ducts. Scale bars = 1 mm. Abbreviations: aaf, anterior annular flange; ch, chitinelipsen; cs, capsula seminalis ; drd, ductus receptaculi distal; drp, ductus receptaculi proximal; g9, gonapophyses IX; gc8, gonocoxites VIII; gc9, gonocoxites IX; la8, laterotergites VIII; la9, laterotergites IX; paf, posterior annular flange; va, vesicular area.

Comments. The only recent reference dealing with this species is by Bar„o et al . (2017) who studied the external scent efferent system of
S. comma
using scanning electron microscopy and optical microscopy.
